name: Neill et al., Appellants, v. Harry C. Kahn & Son, Inc.
name_abbreviation: Neill v. Harry C. Kahn & Son, Inc.

judges: Before Kephabt, C. J., Schafeeb, Maxey, Dbew, Linn, Steen and Babnes, JJ.
parties: Neill et al., Appellants, v. Harry C. Kahn & Son, Inc.

opinions.text:
Opinion by
Mr. Justice Schaepeb,
This case is ruled by Neill v. Gimbel Brothers, Inc., 330 Pa. 213. It is ordered that the decree of the court below be modified as therein directed. Costs to be paid by defendant.
Mr. Justice Dbew dissents.
opinions.author: Mr. Justice Schaepeb,

attorneys: Robert T. McCracken, with him Nochem 8. Winnet and Ceorge C. Chandler, for appellants.
Joseph B. Winokur, of Loewenstein & Winokur, with him Evans, Bayard & Frick, Brown & Williams and Bundheim, Folz <& Bundheim, for appellee.
Carlos Berguido, Jr., and Robert Rosenberg, filed a brief on behalf of Betail Opticians of America, amici curiae.
casebody.head_matter:
Neill et al., Appellants, v. Harry C. Kahn & Son, Inc.
Argued January 11, 1938.
Before Kephabt, C. J., Schafeeb, Maxey, Dbew, Linn, Steen and Babnes, JJ.
Robert T. McCracken, with him Nochem 8. Winnet and Ceorge C. Chandler, for appellants.
Joseph B. Winokur, of Loewenstein & Winokur, with him Evans, Bayard & Frick, Brown & Williams and Bundheim, Folz <& Bundheim, for appellee.
Carlos Berguido, Jr., and Robert Rosenberg, filed a brief on behalf of Betail Opticians of America, amici curiae.
March 21, 1938:
